measured_by: participants’ unstructured verbal reports classified with NLP models
justification: “We capitalize on recent advances in Natural Language Processing ... and recommend using them to classify participants' unstructured verbal descriptions of the strategies they use to perform tasks.”

measured_by: β parameter of the Distance Model
justification: “β is a free parameter representing the weight people assign to the relative distance between their own choices and the choices made by others … a lower boundary of β = 0 representing ignoring others … an upper boundary β = 1 indicating a full integration of others' choices.”
construct: Weight assigned to social information / Information-integration weight

measured_by: r parameter of the Bayesian Updating Model
justification: “r is a freely varying resistance parameter that measures the extent to which people inhibit the updating of their prior preference … If r = 0, no resistance is present … if r > 0, the individual is increasingly resistant towards updating.”
construct: Resistance to social influence / Social resistance

measured_by: proportion of Jar A vs. Jar B choices in the risky-choice jar task
justification: “Risk seeking individuals are those, who chose Jar A … on the majority of trials. Risk averse individuals are those, who chose Jar B … on the majority of trials.”
construct: Risk preference / Risk seeking vs. risk aversion
